intro: Stellaria calycantha, commonly known as the showy starwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like carnations and chickweed. The plant is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and arranged alternately along the stem, and it typically grows in moist, grassy areas. Stellaria calycantha is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
